intro: Jurinea transsilvania, commonly known as the Transylvanian sandwort, is a low-growing flowering plant native to the Carpathian Mountains. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. It is adapted to harsh environmental conditions, including cold temperatures and limited nutrients. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species in its native range.
